column13: Cao Cao rises amid chaos, unifying northern China through military strength and administrative reform, laying the foundation for Wei.

column9: With vast territory and resources, Wei becomes the strongest of the three kingdoms, enforcing strict laws and centralized rule.
Wei reaches its height in population, economy, and military power, holding decisive advantage over its rivals.
Internal struggles and the rise of the Sima family weaken the authority of the Cao rulers.
The Wei emperor is forced to abdicate, and the Sima clan establishes the Jin dynasty, bringing Wei to an end.
